intro: Sciodaphyllum goudotii, commonly known as the African mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and typically grows on the branches of host trees such as Acacia and Combretaceae species. The plant has small, leathery leaves and produces white or yellowish flowers that are often clustered together. Its berries, which are usually red or yellow, contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Sciodaphyllum goudotii plays a role in the ecosystem by providing food for certain bird species and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
